meanings.definition: To make blissfully happy or blessed.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful sunset was beatifying the whole sky.
meanings.sent2: The kind gesture from her friend was beatifying her day.
meanings.sent3: The delicious cake was beatifying everyone's taste buds.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was beatifying the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful garden was beatifying the surroundings.

meanings.definition: To declare someone to be a saint.
meanings.sent1: The Pope will be beatifying the nun for her selfless work.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony will involve beatifying the local hero.
meanings.sent3: The town decided to beatify their beloved mayor for his dedication.
meanings.sent4: The council will discuss beatifying the philanthropist next week.
meanings.sent5: The community is excited about beatifying their patron saint.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was beatifying the students for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work was beatified by critics worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The chef beatified the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: The author's words beatified the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered, beatifying the winning team.
